00053 //******************************************************************************
00054 //   eZ430-RF2500 Temperature Sensor End Device
00055 //
00056 //   Description: This is the End Device software for the eZ430-2500RF
00057 //                Temperature Sensing demo
00058 //
00059 //
00060 //   Z. Shivers
00061 //   Version    1.05
00062 //   Texas Instruments, Inc
00063 //   July 2010
00064 //   Known working builds:
00065 //     IAR Embedded Workbench Kickstart (Version: 5.10.4)
00066 //     Code Composer Studio (Version 4.1.2.00027)
00067 //******************************************************************************
00068 //Change Log:
00069 //******************************************************************************
00070 //Version:  1.05
00071 //Comments: Added support for various baud rates dependent on CPU frequencies
00072 //Version:  1.04
00073 //Comments: Added support for SimpliciTI 1.1.1
00074 //          Moved radio wakeup in linkTo() to after ADC code to save power
00075 //          Replaced delays with __delay_cylces() instrinsic
00076 //          Replaced toggleLED with BSP functions
00077 //          Added more comments
00078 //Version:  1.03
00079 //Comments: Added support for SimpliciTI 1.1.0
00080 //          Added support for Code Composer Studio
00081 //          Added security (Enabled with -DSMPL_SECURE in smpl_nwk_config.dat)
00082 //          Added acknowledgement (Enabled with -DAPP_AUTO_ACK in smpl_nwk_config.dat)
00083 //          Based the modifications on the AP_as_Data_Hub example code
00084 //Version:  1.02
00085 //Comments: Changed Port toggling to abstract method
00086 //          Fixed comment typos
00087 //Version:  1.01
00088 //Comments: Added support for SimpliciTI 1.0.3
00089 //          Added Flash storage/check of Random address
00090 //          Moved LED toggle to HAL
00091 //Version:  1.00
00092 //Comments: Initial Release Version

00094 #include "bsp.h"
00095 #include "mrfi.h"
00096 #include "nwk_types.h"
00097 #include "nwk_api.h"
00098 #include "bsp_leds.h"
00099 #include "bsp_buttons.h"
00100 #include "vlo_rand.h"

00102 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00103  * Defines
00104  *----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00105 /* How many times to try a TX and miss an acknowledge before doing a scan */
00106 #define MISSES_IN_A_ROW  2
00107 
00108 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00109  * Prototypes
00110  *----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00111 static void linkTo(void);
00112 void createRandomAddress(void);
00113 __interrupt void ADC10_ISR(void);
00114 __interrupt void Timer_A (void);
00115 
00116 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00117 * Globals
00118 ------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00119 static linkID_t sLinkID1 = 0;
00120 /* Temperature offset set at production */
00121 volatile int * tempOffset = (int *)0x10F4;
00122 /* Initialize radio address location */
00123 char * Flash_Addr = (char *)0x10F0;
00124 /* Work loop semaphores */
00125 static volatile uint8_t sSelfMeasureSem = 0;
00126 
00127 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00128  * Main
00129  *----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00130 void main (void)
00131 {
00132   addr_t lAddr;
00133 
00134   /* Initialize board-specific hardware */
00135   BSP_Init();
00136 
00137   /* Check flash for previously stored address */
00138   if(Flash_Addr[0] == 0xFF && Flash_Addr[1] == 0xFF &&
00139      Flash_Addr[2] == 0xFF && Flash_Addr[3] == 0xFF )
00140   {
00141     createRandomAddress(); // Create and store a new random address
00142   }
00143 
00144   /* Read out address from flash */
00145   lAddr.addr[0] = Flash_Addr[0];
00146   lAddr.addr[1] = Flash_Addr[1];
00147   lAddr.addr[2] = Flash_Addr[2];
00148   lAddr.addr[3] = Flash_Addr[3];
00149 
00150   /* Tell network stack the device address */
00151   SMPL_Ioctl(IOCTL_OBJ_ADDR, IOCTL_ACT_SET, &lAddr);
00152 
00153   /* Initialize TimerA and oscillator */
00154   BCSCTL3 |= LFXT1S_2;                      // LFXT1 = VLO
00155   TACCTL0 = CCIE;                           // TACCR0 interrupt enabled
00156   TACCR0 = 12000;                           // ~ 1 sec
00157   TACTL = TASSEL_1 + MC_1;                  // ACLK, upmode
00158 
00159   /* Keep trying to join (a side effect of successful initialization) until
00160    * successful. Toggle LEDS to indicate that joining has not occurred.
00161    */
00162   while (SMPL_SUCCESS != SMPL_Init(0))
00163   {
00164     BSP_TOGGLE_LED1();
00165     BSP_TOGGLE_LED2();
00166     /* Go to sleep (LPM3 with interrupts enabled)
00167      * Timer A0 interrupt will wake CPU up every second to retry initializing
00168      */
00169     __bis_SR_register(LPM3_bits+GIE);  // LPM3 with interrupts enabled
00170   }
00171 
00172   /* LEDs on solid to indicate successful join. */
00173   BSP_TURN_ON_LED1();
00174   BSP_TURN_ON_LED2();
00175 
00176   /* Unconditional link to AP which is listening due to successful join. */
00177   linkTo();
00178 
00179   while(1);
00180 }
00181 
00182 static void linkTo()
00183 {
00184   uint8_t msg[3];
00185 #ifdef APP_AUTO_ACK
00186   uint8_t misses, done;
00187 #endif
00188 
00189   /* Keep trying to link... */
00190   while (SMPL_SUCCESS != SMPL_Link(&sLinkID1))
00191   {
00192     BSP_TOGGLE_LED1();
00193     BSP_TOGGLE_LED2();
00194     /* Go to sleep (LPM3 with interrupts enabled)
00195      * Timer A0 interrupt will wake CPU up every second to retry linking
00196      */
00197     __bis_SR_register(LPM3_bits+GIE);
00198   }
00199 
00200   /* Turn off LEDs. */
00201   BSP_TURN_OFF_LED1();
00202   BSP_TURN_OFF_LED2();
00203 
00204   /* Put the radio to sleep */
00205   SMPL_Ioctl(IOCTL_OBJ_RADIO, IOCTL_ACT_RADIO_SLEEP, 0);
00206 
00207   while (1)
00208   {
00209     /* Go to sleep, waiting for interrupt every second to acquire data */
00210     __bis_SR_register(LPM3_bits);
00211 
00212     /* Time to measure */
00213     if (sSelfMeasureSem) {
00214       volatile long temp;
00215       int degC, volt;
00216       int results[2];
00217 #ifdef APP_AUTO_ACK
00218       uint8_t      noAck;
00219       smplStatus_t rc;
00220 #endif
00221 
00222       /* Get temperature */
00223       ADC10CTL1 = INCH_10 + ADC10DIV_4;       // Temp Sensor ADC10CLK/5
00224       ADC10CTL0 = SREF_1 + ADC10SHT_3 + REFON + ADC10ON + ADC10IE + ADC10SR;
00225       /* Allow ref voltage to settle for at least 30us (30us * 8MHz = 240 cycles)
00226        * See SLAS504D for settling time spec
00227        */
00228       __delay_cycles(240);
00229       ADC10CTL0 |= ENC + ADC10SC;             // Sampling and conversion start
00230       __bis_SR_register(CPUOFF + GIE);        // LPM0 with interrupts enabled
00231       results[0] = ADC10MEM;                  // Retrieve result
00232       ADC10CTL0 &= ~ENC;
00233 
00234       /* Get voltage */
00235       ADC10CTL1 = INCH_11;                     // AVcc/2
00236       ADC10CTL0 = SREF_1 + ADC10SHT_2 + REFON + ADC10ON + ADC10IE + REF2_5V;
00237       __delay_cycles(240);
00238       ADC10CTL0 |= ENC + ADC10SC;             // Sampling and conversion start
00239       __bis_SR_register(CPUOFF + GIE);        // LPM0 with interrupts enabled
00240       results[1] = ADC10MEM;                  // Retrieve result
00241 
00242       /* Stop and turn off ADC */
00243       ADC10CTL0 &= ~ENC;
00244       ADC10CTL0 &= ~(REFON + ADC10ON);
00245 
00246       /* oC = ((A10/1024)*1500mV)-986mV)*1/3.55mV = A10*423/1024 - 278
00247        * the temperature is transmitted as an integer where 32.1 = 321
00248        * hence 4230 instead of 423
00249        */
00250       temp = results[0];
00251       degC = ((temp - 673) * 4230) / 1024;
00252       if( (*tempOffset) != 0xFFFF )
00253       {
00254         degC += (*tempOffset);
00255       }
00256 
00257       /* message format,  UB = upper Byte, LB = lower Byte
00258       -------------------------------
00259       |degC LB | degC UB |  volt LB |
00260       -------------------------------
00261          0         1          2
00262       */
00263       temp = results[1];
00264       volt = (temp*25)/512;
00265       msg[0] = degC&0xFF;
00266       msg[1] = (degC>>8)&0xFF;
00267       msg[2] = volt;
00268 
00269       /* Get radio ready...awakens in idle state */
00270       SMPL_Ioctl( IOCTL_OBJ_RADIO, IOCTL_ACT_RADIO_AWAKE, 0);
00271 
00272 #ifdef APP_AUTO_ACK
00273       /* Request that the AP sends an ACK back to confirm data transmission
00274        * Note: Enabling this section more than DOUBLES the current consumption
00275        *       due to the amount of time IN RX waiting for the AP to respond
00276        */
00277       done = 0;
00278       while (!done)
00279       {
00280         noAck = 0;
00281 
00282         /* Try sending message MISSES_IN_A_ROW times looking for ack */
00283         for (misses=0; misses < MISSES_IN_A_ROW; ++misses)
00284         {
00285           if (SMPL_SUCCESS == (rc=SMPL_SendOpt(sLinkID1, msg, sizeof(msg), SMPL_TXOPTION_ACKREQ)))
00286           {
00287             /* Message acked. We're done. Toggle LED 1 to indicate ack received. */
00288             BSP_TURN_ON_LED1();
00289             __delay_cycles(2000);
00290             BSP_TURN_OFF_LED1();
00291             break;
00292           }
00293           if (SMPL_NO_ACK == rc)
00294           {
00295             /* Count ack failures. Could also fail becuase of CCA and
00296              * we don't want to scan in this case.
00297              */
00298             noAck++;
00299           }
00300         }
00301         if (MISSES_IN_A_ROW == noAck)
00302         {
00303           /* Message not acked */
00304           BSP_TURN_ON_LED2();
00305           __delay_cycles(2000);
00306           BSP_TURN_OFF_LED2();
00307 #ifdef FREQUENCY_AGILITY
00308           /* Assume we're on the wrong channel so look for channel by
00309            * using the Ping to initiate a scan when it gets no reply. With
00310            * a successful ping try sending the message again. Otherwise,
00311            * for any error we get we will wait until the next button
00312            * press to try again.
00313            */
00314           if (SMPL_SUCCESS != SMPL_Ping(sLinkID1))
00315           {
00316             done = 1;
00317           }
00318 #else
00319           done = 1;
00320 #endif  /* FREQUENCY_AGILITY */
00321         }
00322         else
00323         {
00324           /* Got the ack or we don't care. We're done. */
00325           done = 1;
00326         }
00327       }
00328 #else
00329 
00330       /* No AP acknowledgement, just send a single message to the AP */
00331       SMPL_SendOpt(sLinkID1, msg, sizeof(msg), SMPL_TXOPTION_NONE);
00332 
00333 #endif /* APP_AUTO_ACK */
00334 
00335       /* Put radio back to sleep */
00336       SMPL_Ioctl( IOCTL_OBJ_RADIO, IOCTL_ACT_RADIO_SLEEP, 0);
00337 
00338       /* Done with measurement, disable measure flag */
00339       sSelfMeasureSem = 0;
00340     }
00341   }
00342 }
00343 
00344 void createRandomAddress()
00345 {
00346   unsigned int rand, rand2;
00347   do
00348   {
00349     rand = TI_getRandomIntegerFromVLO();    // first byte can not be 0x00 of 0xFF
00350   }
00351   while( (rand & 0xFF00)==0xFF00 || (rand & 0xFF00)==0x0000 );
00352   rand2 = TI_getRandomIntegerFromVLO();
00353 
00354   BCSCTL1 = CALBC1_1MHZ;                    // Set DCO to 1MHz
00355   DCOCTL = CALDCO_1MHZ;
00356   FCTL2 = FWKEY + FSSEL0 + FN1;             // MCLK/3 for Flash Timing Generator
00357   FCTL3 = FWKEY + LOCKA;                    // Clear LOCK & LOCKA bits
00358   FCTL1 = FWKEY + WRT;                      // Set WRT bit for write operation
00359 
00360   Flash_Addr[0]=(rand>>8) & 0xFF;
00361   Flash_Addr[1]=rand & 0xFF;
00362   Flash_Addr[2]=(rand2>>8) & 0xFF;
00363   Flash_Addr[3]=rand2 & 0xFF;
00364 
00365   FCTL1 = FWKEY;                            // Clear WRT bit
00366   FCTL3 = FWKEY + LOCKA + LOCK;             // Set LOCK & LOCKA bit
00367 }
00368 
00369 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00370  * ADC10 interrupt service routine
00371  *----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00372 #pragma vector=ADC10_VECTOR
00373 __interrupt void ADC10_ISR(void)
00374 {
00375   __bic_SR_register_on_exit(CPUOFF);        // Clear CPUOFF bit from 0(SR)
00376 }
00377 
00378 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00379  * Timer A0 interrupt service routine
00380  *----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00381 #pragma vector=TIMERA0_VECTOR
00382 __interrupt void Timer_A (void)
00383 {
00384   sSelfMeasureSem = 1;
00385   __bic_SR_register_on_exit(LPM3_bits);        // Clear LPM3 bit from 0(SR)
00386 }
